name: Bachelor of Science in Computer Engineering

requirements.name: I. Core Curriculum Requirements: 42 semester credit hours2

options.description: Or select any 6 semester credit hours from Communication Core courses (see advisor)
Or select any 3 semester credit hours from Mathematics Core courses (see advisor)
Or select any 6 semester credit hours from Life and Physical Sciences Core courses (see advisor)
Select any 3 semester credit hours from Language, Philosophy and Culture Core courses (see advisor)
Select any 3 semester credit hours from Creative Arts Core courses (see advisor)

Or select any 6 semester credit hours from Government/Political Science Option courses (see advisor)

requirements.name: II. Major Requirements: 79 semester credit hours

options.name: Select one of the following laboratories:

Students take 9 semester credit hours from any 4000 level course from the list below. Independent Study in Computer Engineering (CE 4V97), Undergraduate Research in Computer Engineering (CE 4V98), or Senior Honors in Computer Engineering (CE 4399) may be used for up to 6 of these hours.

requirements.name: III. Elective Requirements: 5 semester credit hours

options.description: Both lower-and upper-division courses may count as free electives, but students must complete at least 51 semester credit hours of upper-division courses to qualify for graduation.

Degree programs in the Erik Jonsson School of Engineering and Computer Science are governed by various accreditation boards that place restrictions on classes used to meet the curricular requirements of degrees they certify. For this reason, not all classes offered by the University can be used to meet elective requirements. Please check with your academic advisor before enrolling in classes you hope to use as free electives.
